item.title: Getting the job and growing in the job: Career Development and Mentorship
item.description:
Panel on Getting the Job / Growing in the Job, with a focus on the role of professional mentorship

Drop in Mentorship Hours with volunteer mentors

item.title: Bias in AI Algorithms
item.description: Dr. Marshall will discuss bias is AI algorithms and Alise Otilia Rameriz will discuss her article in the Medium discussing how Algorithms Systemize Discriminatory Practices.

item.title: Integrating Tableau and R with Jarrett Hurms
item.description: Join us for this seminar how on to effectively integrate Tableau and R for easer, more efficient data analysis.

item.title: Avoid the Blank Stare: How to Tell a Great Story with Data
item.description: Workshop with Candra McRae to learn how to tell a story with your data.

item.title: COVID19 Health Disparities with Andrea Hobby
item.description: Andrea Hobby gives a summary of the current health disparities seen in COVID19 patients.

item.title: Black In Data Visualisation Challenge
item.description:
Introduction: As creators of Black In Data, we are mindful of the harmful ways Black people have been presented in data historically and to this day. We are interested in unpicking how we relate this this, as Black data professionals, and how we work against this in our day-to-day. We are hosting the “Black In Data Visualisation Challenge” to showcase the data visualisation skills of the many talented Black people in the field of data sciences. We also host this challenge to highlight data that shows Black people in a positive light (we thought long and hard about which dataset to use - we hope you like it), and to highlight the power of collaboration (as seen in ours with the Data Visualization Society).

Submission Information: Please submit your data visualisation image as a pdf, with a title/description to complement. Deadlines for submission are January 4th, 2021 at 1200 BST. Submissions will be judged on their message, design, and clarity.

Eligibility criteria: All competition entrants must identify as a person of the Black diaspora. In submitting your image to us, you confirm that you have performed the data analysis to produce the image yourself. You also give permission for us to share the image with our judging panel, host your image on the Data Visualization Society online gallery (with your name accredited), and to share the image on the Black In Data twitter (with your name accredited).

Link to data source: TBA

Link to collecting submissions: TBA

item.title: Scrapping for a Data Job with Sia Seko
item.description: Scrapping for a Data Job: A brief description of natural language processing, and an ongoing application of it to show how it is being used to make a data science job search more efficient

item.title: Introduction to R with Dr. A. Nayena Blankson
Machine Learning Tutorial with Ayodele Odubela
Data Journeys Panel
item.description: Data Journeys: Health information, technology, informatics, data science, epidemiology, social science, and self-teaching. Fireside chat with TIDES, Kimberly, Odane, Teneika, Amber, Ruth, and Blossom.

item.title: Survival strategies in Data careers with Jakyll
Data analytics careers after 40 with Kimberly Deas
item.description: Lunchtime webinar on how to enter the data analytics careers after age 40.

item.title: #BlackInDataRollCall
item.description:
Introduce yourself and tell us what you do in data and include the hashtag #BlackInDataRollCall and tag @BlkInData

Sign up to be a mentor or mentee for Drop-In Mentorship Hours throughout the week!
